verses.verse: {A Prayer for Deliverance} d Lord , remember what has happened to us. Pay attention, and look at our shame!
Our inheritance has {Or possessions have} been turned over to strangers, and our homes to foreigners.
We are now orphans without fathers and our mothers are like widows.
We pay to drink our own water, and our own wood is sold to us at high price.
Our pursuers breathe down {Lit. pursuers are on} our necks; we are weary, but there is no rest for us.
We made a deal with the Egyptians and the Assyrians for the price of food. {Lit. Assyrians, being satisfied with bread}
Our ancestors sinned and no longer exist yet we continue to bear the consequences of their sin.
Slaves rule over us, and no one delivers us from their control. {Lit. hand}
We risk our lives to obtain our food, facing death {Lit. facing the sword} in the desert.
Our skin blisters {Lit. blackens} as from an oven, due to ravaging blasts of the famine.
They have raped women in Zion, young women {Lit. the virgins} in the towns of Judah.
Princes they have hung by their hands; elders {Lit. the faces of the elders} they have disrespected.
Our {The Heb. lacks Our} young men must grind grain with a millstone; our {The Heb. lacks our} youths stumble under the weight of wood.
Our {The Heb. lacks Our} elders have ceased ruling {The Heb. lacks ruling} at the gate; our {The Heb. lacks our} young men have abandoned {The Heb. lacks have abandoned} their music.
The joy of our hearts has ceased, and our dancing has turned into dirges.
The crown has fallen from our head woe to us, because we have sinned!
This is why our hearts faint, and why our eyes grow dim:
Because Mount Zion is desolate; foxes roam around it.
You, Lord , are forever your throne endures from generation to generation.
So why have you completely forgotten us, forsaking us for so long?
Restore us to yourself, Lord , so that we may return. Renew our days as before,
unless you have utterly rejected us and are angry with us without limit.
